1.verse: Greeting - Paul, a bondservant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect and the acknowledgment of the truth which accords with godliness,

2.verse: in hope of eternal life which God, who cannot lie, promised before time began,

3.verse: but has in due time manifested His word through preaching, which was committed to me according to the commandment of God our Savior;

4.verse: To Titus, a true son in our common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.

5.verse: Qualified Elders - For this reason I left you in Crete, that you should set in order the things that are lacking, and appoint elders in every city as I commanded you—

6.verse: if a man is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of dissipation or insubordination.

7.verse: For a bishop must be blameless, as a steward of God, not self-willed, not quick-tempered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for money,

8.verse: but hospitable, a lover of what is good, sober-minded, just, holy, self-controlled,

9.verse: holding fast the faithful word as he has been taught, that he may be able, by sound doctrine, both to exhort and convict those who contradict.

10.verse: The Elders’ Task - For there are many insubordinate, both idle talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,

11.verse: whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole households, teaching things which they ought not, for the sake of dishonest gain.

12.verse: One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons.”

13.verse: This testimony is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,

14.verse: not giving heed to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn from the truth.

15.verse: To the pure all things are pure, but to those who are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but even their mind and conscience are defiled.

16.verse: They profess to know God, but in works they deny Him, being abominable, disobedient, and disqualified for every good work.

1.verse: Qualities of a Sound Church - But as for you, speak the things which are proper for sound doctrine:

2.verse: that the older men be sober, reverent, temperate, sound in faith, in love, in patience;

3.verse: the older women likewise, that they be reverent in behavior, not slanderers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things—

4.verse: that they admonish the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,

5.verse: to be discreet, chaste, homemakers, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be blasphemed.

6.verse: Likewise, exhort the young men to be sober-minded,

7.verse: in all things showing yourself to be a pattern of good works; in doctrine showing integrity, reverence, incorruptibility,

8.verse: sound speech that cannot be condemned, that one who is an opponent may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say of you.

9.verse: Exhort bondservants to be obedient to their own masters, to be well pleasing in all things, not answering back,

10.verse: not pilfering, but showing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things.

11.verse: Trained by Saving Grace - For the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men,

12.verse: teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly in the present age,

13.verse: looking for the blessed hope and glorious appearing of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,

14.verse: who gave Himself for us, that He might redeem us from every lawless deed and purify for Himself His own special people, zealous for good works.

15.verse: Speak these things, exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no one despise you.

1.verse: Graces of the Heirs of Grace - Remind them to be subject to rulers and authorities, to obey, to be ready for every good work,

2.verse: to speak evil of no one, to be peaceable, gentle, showing all humility to all men.

3.verse: For we ourselves were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another.

4.verse: But when the kindness and the love of God our Savior toward man appeared,

5.verse: not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to His mercy He saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit,

6.verse: whom He poured out on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior,

7.verse: that having been justified by His grace we should become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

8.verse: This is a faithful saying, and these things I want you to affirm constantly, that those who have believed in God should be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men.

9.verse: Avoid Dissension - But avoid foolish disputes, genealogies, contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and useless.

10.verse: Reject a divisive man after the first and second admonition,

11.verse: knowing that such a person is warped and sinning, being self-condemned.

12.verse: Final Messages - When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.

13.verse: Send Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey with haste, that they may lack nothing.

14.verse: And let our people also learn to maintain good works, to meet urgent needs, that they may not be unfruitful.

15.verse: Farewell - All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
